segments.text: From my angle, I see a woman who is the embodiment of domesticity, oblivious to her surroundings.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: Her focus is so intense; she's polishing that plate like it’s the most important task in the world.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: Meanwhile, the sink is a disaster, and I feel a surge of frustration.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: How can she not notice the water spilling everywhere?
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The children are literally inches away from chaos, and she’s just standing there.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: That boy is precariously perched on a stool that looks like it could flip any second.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: Is it really worth the risk for a couple of cookies? It makes me want to yell.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I can see his sister’s outstretched hand, and it’s just so innocent, yet so misguided.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The bright garden outside looks like a safe haven compared to this unfolding scene.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: It’s funny how oblivious people can be, wrapped up in their routines.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I wish she’d just glance over her shoulder and understand the danger.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I think of all the times I was distracted and danger sneaked up on me like this.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: It’s moments like these that remind us to be vigilant, even when we’re comfortable.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I can feel a knot in my stomach; something is bound to happen here.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: And yet, it’s hard to tear myself away from the scene; it’s almost mesmerizing.
segments.speaker: PAR
